intro: Mentha deflexa, commonly known as narrow-leaf mint, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually purple or blue, arranged in dense spikes at the top of the stems. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a strong, minty aroma when crushed. Mentha deflexa is often found in moist soils along stream banks, wet meadows, and woodland edges.
